conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric-style 3D model with extruded walls, visible thickness, and readable interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness, distinct floor plane, good corner geometry, and clean roof cutaway; mild simplification around door openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall shell and main room placements (living/kitchen left, bedroom top-right, bathroom near center-right) broadly match, but the right-side stair zone in the 2D plan is not represented as stairs in the 3D model, significantly altering that portion of the layout. Door/opening geometry is also stylized (curved cutouts) vs plan swing doors.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture exists (bed, sofa, table) and bathroom fixtures are present; kitchen is simplified and not fully faithful to the plan’s linear counters/island arrangement.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors with clean presentation and no UI/text contamination; lighting is neutral and does not hide geometry.

detected_errors.description: Staircase area shown on the right side of the 2D plan is missing/not modeled as stairs in the 3D render, changing room function and circulation geometry.
Door openings are rendered as curved/arched voids rather than plan-accurate hinged door placements and widths.
Some internal partition shapes/proportions around the hall/bathroom zone differ from the 2D plan, likely due to simplification of wall runs and openings.

summary: A true and clear 3D cutaway is produced, but layout fidelity is reduced by a major mismatch where the 2D stair zone is not accurately converted into a staircase in 3D.
